intro: Epilobium steckerianum, commonly known as Stecker's willowherb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are showy, with five pink to purple petals and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Epilobium steckerianum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with partial to full sunlight.
